dictionary_like_definitions.definition: An intense feeling of deep affection and care for someone or something.
A great interest and pleasure in something.
A relational practice involving attachment, care, intimacy, responsibility, and commitment.

philosophical_definitions.quote: Love is the will to extend oneself for the purpose of nurturing one own or another spiritual growth.
philosophical_definitions.author: M. Scott Peck

philosophical_definitions.quote: Love is not primarily a relationship to a specific person; it is an attitude, an orientation of character.
philosophical_definitions.author: Erich Fromm

philosophical_definitions.quote: Love is composed of a single soul inhabiting two bodies.
philosophical_definitions.author: Attributed to Aristotle

philosophical_definitions.quote: Love is a serious mental disease.
philosophical_definitions.author: Attributed to Plato
philosophical_definitions.work: Often linked to dialogues on eros

models.name: Triangular Theory of Love
models.description: Combinations of three components yield distinct love forms (e.g., romantic, companionate, consummate).

models.name: Attachment Theory (Adult Romantic Attachment)
models.description: Early attachment patterns influence adult romantic expectations and behaviors.

models.name: Love Styles (Colors of Love)
models.description: Six stylistic ways individuals experience and express love.

key_constructs.meaning: Decision to maintain love and loyalty over time.

neurochemistry.role: Reward, motivation, and salience in early-stage romantic love.
Pair-bonding and long-term attachment (noted in prairie vole models).
Mood regulation; altered levels associated with early infatuation.

brain_regions.role: Dopaminergic reward circuit activation in romantic love.

evolutionary_view.point: Preferences that may enhance reproductive success.
Attachment and pair-bonding to support offspring survival.
Altruism and bonding to strengthen group survival.

notable_researchers.name: Helen Fisher
notable_researchers.contribution: Three systems: lust, romantic attraction, attachment.

notable_researchers.name: Lucy L. Brown
notable_researchers.contribution: Neuroimaging of romantic love and reward circuitry.

notable_researchers.name: Andreas Bartels & Semir Zeki
notable_researchers.contribution: fMRI studies on romantic and maternal love.

quotes.text: How do I love thee? Let me count the ways.
quotes.author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

quotes.text: Being deeply loved by someone gives you strength, while loving someone deeply gives you courage.
quotes.author: Attributed to Lao Tzu

quotes.text: The very essence of romance is uncertainty.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.text: We are most alive when we in love.
quotes.author: John Updike

quotes.text: To love and be loved is to feel the sun from both sides.
quotes.author: David Viscott

literary_references.author: Plato
literary_references.note: Dialogues exploring different speeches on the nature of love (eros).

literary_references.author: William Shakespeare
literary_references.note: Meditation on steadfastness and constancy in love.

literary_references.author: Dante Alighieri
literary_references.note: Love as a metaphysical and theological force guiding the soul.

literary_references.author: Rumi
literary_references.note: Mystical Sufi poetry emphasizing love as path to the divine.

literary_references.author: Sappho
literary_references.note: Ancient lyric poetry capturing desire and longing.

literary_references.author: Jane Austen
literary_references.note: Romantic love, choice, and social commentary.

intended_reputable_sources: Canonical literature (Plato; Shakespeare; Dante; Sappho; Rumi)
